Description: Fragment of marble block, bearing incised Greek text. Top, bottom and front preserved; also a small section of left side. The right side is probably just preserved at the front. There is anathyrosis on the top and left, and perhaps on the right. A wear mark suggests this was topped by a further block, part of a stepped base. Ionian marble.
Curator's comments: Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47), p. 168 and 172. Names, Kleainetos, son of Aristothemis and Maiandrios, son of Stratonides.
Bibliographic references: Inscription / The Collection of Ancient Greek Inscriptions in the British Museum (1083)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (no. 20, pl. 39, 1-2)
Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 35, pl. XXX, no. 4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (BA.08)
